titles.title: Congressional Pay Accountability Act
To provide for a mechanism by which a Member of, or Member-elect to, Congress may decline an annual pay adjustment.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Government Reform, and in addition to the Committee on House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

bill.summary: 7/27/1999--Introduced. Congressional Pay Accountability Act - Amends the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 to authorize a Member or Member-elect to Congress to decline an annual pay adjustment scheduled to take effect on or after January 1, 2001.
